I say this not to call out any I’ve been lucky enough to work with, but hoping to help freelancers local journalists fixers translators out there: If we value foreign reporting, & we must now more than ever, let’s invest in it! END
Was a reminder how often Western or American or foreign journalists protected from risks others are not, & their bravery.

@Jodi_Hilton Another backstory: In Istanbul when news broke Jamal Khashoggi disappeared in Saudi consulate then that he was killed. Had interviewed him for a story not yet pubbed just before I went to Saudi in Oct 2018

Backstory: Having great partner like @Jodi_Hilton absolutely essential. Yet many editors make no connection between low pay or no expenses & a reporter's safety - or, at most cynical, a publication's reputation if something happens. I'm lucky (& lucky to have had HEFAT, at least)

Re: 3k ‘special interest aliens’ apprehended by CBP - yes, there are foreign nationals besides Central Americans who come to US southern border, many to claim asylum - because it turns out “special interest countries,” for ex, with conflict, also produce refugees & asylees 1/
RT @TalKopan: Special interest aliens: https://t.co/4WP3Z8PWHH

Trump is half-right in that most of industrial precursor to fentanyl comes from China - but much of that goes to Mexico. DEA and other law enforcement say 95% of fentanyl itself comes from Mexico - through ports of entry. Wall wouldn’t stop.

You know who represents Border Patrol? Literally, Customs and Border Protection Commissioner Kevin McAleenan (CBP parent agency Border Patrol) who got bigfooted yesterday for Trump to speak flanked by Border Patrol *union* reps, who are not part of his administration.

Backstory: Took me yr+ after @IWMF trip, ~20 countries & other projects in between. Esp when you're often editors' lowest priority, I found balancing travel, reporting, & writing really hard. Almost out of $ at this point, with credit card & student debt. Filed from Bulgaria.

In: Can Megachurches Save El Salvador? I had the space & support from @heathershorn @newrepublic to explore the politics of Evangelicalism, the gangs, and the Salvadoran security state with Trump & US in proper context 6/ https://t.co/ICZ0yFbJD4

Backstory: Q's whether Newsweek still in print (yes!), smoothest file-to-edit-to-publish, great rate & small expenses covered (though delayed). Tough questions again from migrants on 'what reporters get' from their stories, also importance of being on ground as officials deflect

July'18: Trump Immigration Policy Has Plunged Migrants Into a Purgatory In Mexico: ‘It’s As If They Killed You’ @Newsweek - Long before 'Remain in Mexico' announced, Trump admin had already forced Mexico to be waiting room for asylum seekers https://t.co/lvYc7KQJnD 5/

Backstory: Went in with simple question: What is it like growing up girl in El Salvador? Reinforced why women journalists need to support each other despite pressure. Fully funded by @IWMF & great editing yet among worst pay.

March'18 story on how El Salvador's gangs target young girls @TheAtlantic anticipated Sessions' call that gang & domestic violence shouldn't be grounds for asylum, specifically targeting Central American women, & showed the reality beyond the rhetoric https://t.co/DP2cSPqkO4 4/

Backstory: Many, many questions in Nigeria - including from fixer - about why we don't pay people we interview. (Despite others reportedly doing so.) Many US pubs with 1, maybe 2, staff correspondents for all of Africa, but as freelance made - maybe - 1/4 of reporting costs.

Jan'18 Nigerians return from slavery in Libya to thriving sex-trafficking industry back home @washingtonpost - some of hardest reporting I've done, with officials charged with protecting vulnerable returnees exploiting them, but career goal achieved https://t.co/o5xOqeMVVG 3/

Backstory: Took me ~1r, & I could not have done it without @IWMF - at the time, not yet freelance, I was pressured to use vacation for a fully-funded reporting trip to Chiapas. I had a great editor in @coracurrier & @theintercept pays among best I've found - & has *factcheckers*!

@latimes I know, Dec'17, but this @theintercept story on African refugees journeying across the world to try & claim asylum in US highlights the ways in which Trump's migration & nat'sec policies are backfiring https://t.co/ToEJSKf6o5 2/

Know I'm late on this but hey, it's still early 2019. Wanted to share some stories from around the world and back in 2018, and - now safely ensconced in a staff job I love @latimes - some thoughts on how freelancing & foreign reporting is broken, & why that's bad for everyone 1/
